_comment: Pit Window Demo Data - Explains how pit-window optimization works
_description: This mock data demonstrates pit-window calculations that help teams decide the optimal lap range for pit stops. The system compares 'pit now' vs 'stay out' strategies using Monte Carlo simulation.

predictions._pit_now_delta_explanation: Time delta in seconds if pitting now. Negative means pitting now is FASTER (saves 3.8s). This suggests we're in the optimal window.
predictions._pit_now_risk_explanation: Risk percentage (0-100) of pitting now. Lower is better. 22% indicates low risk - good traffic conditions.
predictions._stay_out_delta_explanation: Time delta in seconds if staying out longer. Positive means staying out is SLOWER (loses 1.2s). Tire degradation is accelerating.
predictions._stay_out_risk_explanation: Risk percentage of staying out. 35% is higher risk - tire wear accelerating, traffic may worsen.

top_features.name: TireTempFL
top_features._explanation: Front-left tire temperature impact (45% weight). High temp indicates accelerated wear - key factor in pit window timing.

top_features.name: sector2_stress
top_features._explanation: Sector 2 stress factor (30% weight). High-stress sectors cause faster tire degradation, affecting optimal pit window.

top_features.name: lap_speed_variance
top_features._explanation: Lap speed variance (25% weight). Inconsistent lap times indicate tire degradation - signals approaching pit window.

explanation._pred_median_explanation: Median predicted time impact in seconds. This is the expected time delta from optimal pit strategy.
explanation._confidence_interval_explanation: 90% confidence interval: 2.8s to 4.2s. Shows uncertainty range in predictions.

_pit_window_optimal_explanation: Optimal pit window: Laps 15-17. This range balances tire wear, track position, and traffic. Pitting within this window maximizes race performance.

scenario_context._tire_wear_explanation: Current tire wear at 72%. Approaching critical threshold (~80%) where performance degrades significantly.
scenario_context._position_explanation: P3 position. Close gap behind suggests pitting now could lose position, but staying out risks tire failure.
scenario_context._traffic_explanation: Clear track ahead, car behind. Good conditions for pit stop - less risk of losing time in traffic.

strategy_recommendation._recommended_action_explanation: Recommend pitting now (lap 14-15). The -3.8s delta shows pitting now is optimal. Traffic is clear, and tire wear is accelerating.
reasoning: Tire wear at 72% and accelerating - performance cliff approaching
Clear track ahead - minimal traffic risk
Pit window optimal range (15-17) starting next lap
Staying out risks 1.2s time loss + 35% risk of tire issues

_model_info: Physics-informed ML model trained on historical GR Cup data. Uses tire temperature, degradation curves, and track-specific factors.
